question: The price of the book is marked 20% above the C.P. If the marked price of the book is Rs. 180, then what is the cost of the paper used in a single copy of the book?
answer_description: Clearly, marked price of the book = 120% of C.P.Also, cost of paper = 25% of C.PLet the cost of paper for a single book be Rs.n.Then, 120 : 25 = 180 :nn= Rs.25 x 180= Rs. 37.50 .120

question: If 5500 copies are published and the transportation cost on them amounts to Rs. 82500, then what should be the selling price of the book so that the publisher can earn a profit of 25%?
answer_description: For the publisher to earn a profit of 25%, S.P. = 125% of C.P.Also Transportation Cost = 10% of C.P.Let the S.P. of 5500 books be Rs.x.Then, 10 : 125 = 82500 :xx= Rs.125 x 82500= Rs. 1031250.10S.P. of one book = Rs.1031250= Rs. 187.50 .5500
